text: Froun () is a village in the Bint Jbeil District in southern Lebanon. ==Name== According to E. H. Palmer, the name Furûn comes from "the ovens" or "reservoirs".Palmer, 1881, p. 21 ==History== In 1881, the PEF's Survey of Western Palestine (SWP) described it: "A village, built of stone, containing 100 Metawileh, situated on a hill and surrounded by small gardens and arable land. The water is supplied from rock-cut cisterns."Conder and Kitchener, 1881, SWP I, p. 87 ==References== ==Bibliography== * * ==External links== *Froun, Localiban *Survey of Western Palestine, Map 2: IAA, Wikimedia commons Category:Populated places in Nabatieh Governorate Category:Bint Jbeil District Category:Shia Muslim communities in Lebanon
title: Froun
